com.eatthepath.jvptree

Interface SpatialIndex<P,E extends P>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Collection<E>, Iterable<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    VPTree

    public interface SpatialIndex<P,E extends P>
extends Collection<E>
    A collection of points that can be searched efficiently to find points near a given query point. A spatial index takes two generic types. The first, P, is the base type of point for which distances can be measured. The second, E, is the specific type of point contained within the index. The two ideas are separated because callers may want to use an instance of E when querying the index. For example, an index that is used to search for local businesses might have a base type of GeospatialPoint, but a specific type of HardwareStore, which implements GeospatialPoint but has a number of additional required properties. By separating the types, callers may realize the benefits of using a specific type when working with elements in the index without the need to construct a new HardwareStore instance when querying points. Instead, they might call getNearestNeighbors(Object, int) with a new GeospatialPoint instead of a much heavier HardwareStore.
    Author:
    Jon Chambers

    • Method Detail

      • getNearestNeighbors

        List<E> getNearestNeighbors(P queryPoint,
                            int maxResults)

        Returns a list of the nearest neighbors to a given query point. The returned list is sorted by increasing distance from the query point.

        This returned list will contain at most maxResults elements (and may contain fewer if maxResults is larger than the number of points in the index). If multiple points have the same distance from the query point, the order in which they appear in the returned list is undefined. By extension, if multiple points have the same distance from the query point and those points would "straddle" the end of the returned list, which points are included in the list and which are cut off is not prescribed.

        Parameters:
        queryPoint - the point for which to find neighbors
        maxResults - the maximum length of the returned list
        Returns:
        a list of the nearest neighbors to the given query point sorted by increasing distance from the query point

      • getAllWithinDistance

        List<E> getAllWithinDistance(P queryPoint,
                             double maxDistance)
        Returns a list of all points within a given distance to a query point.
        Parameters:
        queryPoint - the point for which to find neighbors
        maxDistance - the maximum allowable distance from the query point; points farther away than maxDistance will not be included in the returned list
        Returns:
        a list of all points within the given distance to the query point; the returned list is sorted in order of increasing distance from the query point
